treatment.description: Plants 1–3 dm. Basal leaves: petiole usually 0.1–0.3(–0.5) cm; blade 1–3(–4) × 0.1–0.25(–0.4) cm. Inflorescences 5–25 cm. Perianths yellow.
treatment.habitat: oak, pinyon-juniper and montane conifer woodlands
treatment.discussion: Variety cervinum is rare to infrequent in its limited range of eastern Lincoln County, Nevada, southwestern Iron and western Washington counties, Utah, and northeastern Mohave County, Arizona. It is totally disjunct from the typical variety.
